questions.question: What was the Non-co-operation Movement?
questions.answer: It was a mass movement launched by Mahatma Gandhi to protest against British rule using peaceful methods.

questions.question: Mention two causes of the Non-co-operation Movement.
questions.answer: Jallianwala Bagh massacre and the Rowlatt Act were major causes.

questions.question: What methods were adopted in the movement?
questions.answer: Boycott of British goods, schools, courts and promotion of khadi.

questions.question: Why was the movement withdrawn?
questions.answer: It was withdrawn after the Chauri Chaura incident due to violence.

questions.question: What was the importance of the Non-co-operation Movement?
questions.answer: It united people and spread the spirit of nationalism across India.
